entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 4:52PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF WITH THE HIGH TIDE TONIGHT WEST OF THE NUSHAGAK PENINSULA... A strong Bering Sea storm will bring high surf conditions to Bristol Bay with the high tide tonight. The biggest impact will be west of the Nushagak Peninsula where there may be water levels 2 feet above the normal high tide line with high surf on top of that.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 3:21PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain and Rising River Levels This Weekend... Moderate to heavy rainfall over the next several days is forecast over the Seward Peninsula and western Brooks Range, as the remnants of post-tropical typhoon Merbok track northeastward through the Bering Strait. Expect three-day rainfall totals (Today through Sunday night) around 3 inches at Red Dog Mine, around 5 inches in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 1:14PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Prepare for Strong Wind, Snow and Cold above 7500` on Mt. Shasta This Weekend... The first significant change in the weather for the fall season is upon us. A cold upper low pressure system will move into the region Saturday, causing winds to increase with falling snow levels on Mount Shasta.

entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PDT MONDAY... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Quality Advisory...in effect until 3 PM PDT Monday. A Smoke Air Quality Advisory has been issued. Wildfires burning in the region combined with forecasted conditions will cause air quality to reach unhealthy levels.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 4:46AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG AND LOW VISIBILITY EARLY THIS MORNING... Areas of dense fog will reduce visibility below one-half mile resulting in slowed and potentially hazardous driving conditions early this morning. Visibility will slowly improve after sunrise with fog dissipation likely by 10 AM. If driving, slow down, use low beam headlights and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 17 at 3:41AM CDT until September 18 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Strong currents with high wave action expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door County. * WHEN...From 1 PM CDT this afternoon through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected.
